{{Infobox software | name = Zikula | logo = [[Image:Zikula-Logo.gif|272px]] | screenshot = | caption = Zikula's logo. | developer = Zikula Development Team | latest_release_version = Zikula 1.2.7 | latest_release_date = {{release date|2011|05|02}} | latest_preview_version = Zikula 1.3.0-dev | latest_preview_date = | operating_system = [[Cross-platform]] | genre = [[content management system|Content Management System]] and [[web application framework|Web Application Framework]] | license = [[GNU General Public License]] | website = [http://zikula.org/ zikula.org] }} {{Portal|Free software}} '''Zikula''' is a free [[open source]] [[web application framework]] released under the [[GNU General Public License]]. It can be used to develop robust, secure, interactive and editable websites and web based applications. Zikula is written in [[Object-oriented programming|object oriented]] [[PHP]] and is fully modular. It requires a database and may use leading platforms like [[MySQL]], [[PostgreSQL]], [[Oracle Database]] and [[Microsoft SQL Server]].
==Features== *Templating engine for theming *[[Application programming interface|API]] *[[RSS (file format)|RSS]] feeds *[[Internet forum|Forums]] *[[Opinion poll|Polls]] *[[Internationalization and localization|Language internationalization]] *[[Photo sharing|Galleries]] *[[Online chat|Chat]] *[[E-Commerce]] * Games, Reviews, Links... with many third parties add-ons.
== Development == Zikula follows an active development cycle aiming toward frequent releases. Project milestones and roadmap are posted at the Zikula Code Roadmap. Many 3rd party developers build and contribute to extensions for the Zikula Application Framework which are often developed and hosted at the Zikula Code website. Extensions perform tasks like blogging, storing and displaying data, such as images, music, forums, and shopping carts.
